name: Gender Recognition by Voice
data_intro: This database was created to identify a voice as male or female, based upon acoustic properties of the voice and speech. The dataset consists of 3,168 recorded voice samples, collected from male and female speakers. The voice samples are pre-processed by acoustic analysis in R using the seewave and tuneR packages, with an analyzed frequency range of 0hz-280hz ([human vocal range][2]).

num_feature_intro.meanfun: - **meanfun**: average of fundamental frequency measured across acoustic signal
num_feature_intro.minfun: - **minfun**: minimum fundamental frequency measured across acoustic signal
num_feature_intro.maxfun: - **maxfun**: maximum fundamental frequency measured across acoustic signal
num_feature_intro.meandom: - **meandom**: average of dominant frequency measured across acoustic signal
num_feature_intro.mindom: - **mindom**: minimum of dominant frequency measured across acoustic signal
num_feature_intro.maxdom: - **maxdom**: maximum of dominant frequency measured across acoustic signal
num_feature_intro.dfrange: - **dfrange**: range of dominant frequency measured across acoustic signal
num_feature_intro.modindx: - **modindx**: modulation index. Calculated as the accumulated absolute difference between adjacent measurements of fundamental frequencies divided by the frequency range
